name: Adaptive Vision
summary: After years of using black powder weaponry in dimly lit spaces, you've become accustomed to dazzling flashes of light and sudden shifts in illumination.

name: Avenge in Glory
summary: You honor your ally’s life, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 minute.

name: Clan Lore
summary: Your identity as a member of your clan is as central to your sense of self as your dwarven ancestry.

name: Clan Pistol
summary: Raised in the ancient halls of Dongun Hold or the surrounding region, you display your lineage with a clan pistol, rather than a clan dagger.

name: Clan's Edge
summary: By moving your clan dagger with rapid precision, you can protect yourself more effectively.

name: Dongun Education
summary: You're knowledgeable in trades that are important to your people's survival and commercial interests.

name: Dwarven Doughtiness
summary: You are naturally calm and collected in the face of imminent danger.

name: Dwarven Lore
summary: You eagerly absorbed the old stories and traditions of your ancestors, your gods, and your people.

name: Dwarven Weapon Familiarity
summary: Your kin have instilled in you an affinity for hard-hitting weapons, and you prefer these to more elegant arms.

name: Explosive Savant
summary: A lifetime wielding firearms and explosive ordinance amid the chaos of battle has granted you great skill with volatile weapons.

name: Eye for Treasure
summary: You know good artisanship when you see it and can wax poetic about crafting techniques and forms.

name: Fire Savvy
summary: You've grown up around a forge and are well-suited to dealing with smoke and flame.

name: Forge-Day's Rest
summary: Your unusual rest cycle allows you to recover faster.

name: Mountain Strategy
summary: Dwarves have a long history fighting common foes, and you've mastered the ancient tactics to better face these enemies.

name: Rivethun Disciple
summary: By studying with the dwarven shamans of Highhelm, you have become aware of the friction between your body and spirit.

name: Rock Runner
summary: Your innate connection to stone makes you adept at moving across uneven surfaces.

name: Stonemason's Eye
summary: You understand the intricacies of stonework.

name: Surface Culture
summary: Your interactions with other cultures on the surface have not only taught you about many other ancestries, but have also helped you realize the value of your own.

name: Unburdened Iron
summary: You've learned techniques first devised by your ancestors during their ancient wars, allowing you to comfortably wear massive suits of armor.

name: Blast Resistance
summary: You're used to the clamor of steel, the crack of a firearm, and the thunderous blast of explosions.

name: Boulder Roll
summary: Your dwarven build allows you to push foes around, just like a mighty boulder tumbles through a subterranean cavern.

name: Clan Protector
summary: Your clan dagger can protect your allies as easily as yourself.

name: Defy the Darkness
summary: Using ancient dwarven methods developed to fight enemies wielding magical darkness, you've honed your darkvision and sworn not to use such magic yourself.

name: Dwarven Reinforcement
summary: You can use your knowledge of engineering and metalwork to temporarily strengthen thick objects and structures.

name: Dwarven Weapon Cunning
summary: You’ve learned cunning techniques to get the best effects out of your dwarven weapons.

name: Fey Influence
summary: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic

name: Protective Sheath
summary: When you lash out with your clan dagger, you keep its sheath close at hand.

name: Sheltering Slab
summary: The stone around you is your ally, and you have learned to use it to shore up your weaknesses.

name: Spark Fist
summary: You dust explosive black powder on your fist or glove before attacking, which combusts as you hit an opponent.

name: Tomb-Watcher's Glare
summary: When you critically hit an undead creature, or an undead creature critically fails a saving throw against one of your abilities, you drive your divine wrath home in your enemy’s heart.

name: Battleforger
summary: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments.

name: Demolitionist
summary: You know how to destroy objects with a well-placed explosion.

name: Drain Emotion
summary: You touch an adjacent creature and attempt to draw out its excess emotion.

name: Echoes in Stone
summary: You pause a moment to attune your senses to the stone around you.

name: Energy Blessed
summary: Energy runs through your blood more powerfully.

name: Fey Ascension
summary: The fey influence on your form and features grows even more powerful and notable.

name: Heroes' Call
summary: The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits.

name: Kneel for No God
summary: Your ancestors’ defiance of magic and your people’s strictly egalitarian mindset mean that certain forms of magic have little effect on you.

name: Mountain's Stoutness
summary: Your hardiness lets you withstand more punishment than most.

name: Returning Throw
summary: You have mastered the technique of arcing a projectile so that it returns to your hand after being thrown, though this requires a moment to precisely calculate the trajectory and possible ricochets.

name: Rivethun Spiritual Attunement
summary: Your time spent among the Rivethun has heightened your awareness of animate spirits around you, giving you the ability to sense them briefly.

name: Smoke Sight
summary: You're used to fighting and hiding in a haze of smoke and flame.

name: Stone Bones
summary: Your intractable nature can help you shrug off even the most grievous injuries.

name: Stonewalker
summary: You have a deep reverence for and connection to stone.

name: Cannibalize Magic
summary: The fey magic inside of you is a vital part of your body, and you can steal other sources of magic to replenish yours.

name: Crafter's Instinct
summary: You sense a minor flaw in the weapon as you fire it, and quickly adjust your aim on the fly to avoid the flaw.

name: Dwarven Weapon Expertise
summary: Your dwarven affinity blends with your training, granting you great skill with dwarven weapons.

name: Eldritch Calm
summary: Your fey heritage has altered your mindset to more resemble the uncanny perspective of the fey.

name: Explosive Expert
summary: You have continued training in volatile weapons and gained a deeper understanding.

name: Glamour
summary: You unlock a new level of fey power and can manipulate the perceptions of others using a font of First World magic.

name: March the Mines
summary: You march through the earth and lead an ally along.

name: Scrutinizing Gaze
summary: Your family's traditions of defending against Geb's undead have granted you a sixth sense for detecting spirits, haunts, and other restless dead, no matter their form or the strength of their presence.

name: Telluric Power
summary: You channel strength from the earth beneath your feet to pummel your enemies.

name: Fey Transcendence
summary: You become a powerful fey creature, gaining strengths tied to the First World but also some of the weakness against which all fey must contend.

name: Forge-Blessed Shot
summary: You intone a prayer to the dwarven deities Torag or Angradd, willing a higher power to guide your aim in the heat of battle.

name: Stonegate
summary: Earthen barriers no longer impede your progress.

name: Stonewall
summary: The strength of stone overcomes you so strongly that it replaces your stout body.
